medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain first began on an unspecified date and is described as mild in intensity, located in the epigastric region. It does not radiate and has not changed in intensity since onset. The patient reports no nausea, vomiting, fever, or chills, and attributes decreased bowel movements to decreased appetite. There is a noted history of cramping in the left foot, attributed to dehydration, present for over 6 months. The patient experienced a syncopal episode on the morning of presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of esophageal issues, retinal vascular occlusion (branch), prostate cancer (status post radiation therapy), coronary artery disease, migraine headaches, hypercholesterolemia, presbyopia, sensorineural hearing loss, and glaucoma.
